content:
Minestrone soup is a hearty Italian soup that typically includes a variety of vegetables, beans, and pasta. The ingredients may vary depending on the region and the cook, but some common ingredients include:

* Onion
* Garlic
* Carrots
* Celery
* Tomatoes
* Potatoes
* Zucchini
* Green beans
* Cannellini beans
* Pasta (such as small shells, elbow macaroni, or ditalini)
* Vegetable or chicken broth
* Olive oil
* Salt
* Black pepper
* Herbs (such as thyme, rosemary, or bay leaves)

To make the soup, typically the onion, garlic, carrots, and celery are sautéed in olive oil until soft. Then, the other vegetables and broth are added, along with any herbs and spices. The soup is simmered until the vegetables are tender, then the pasta is added and cooked until tender. The soup is seasoned with salt and pepper to taste, and can be served with grated Parmesan cheese and crusty bread.

Minestrone soup is a great way to use up any leftover vegetables and can be made with pantry staples, making it a budget-friendly and satisfying meal.
